messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: I am writing to you as you have expressed concerns about the environment, or told my team you were considering voting for the Green Party at the coming General Election...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Work to leave the world a better place for children. Action not just warm words required to improve 'pollution and aircraft noise'. Against a third runway, set up Hounslow's campaign against expansion at Heathrow.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Marginal constituency between Labour and the Conservatives. Every vote not cast for Labour only makes it one vote easier for the Conservatives to win the election.

issues.environment: Need to fight for a 'Better Not Bigger' Heathrow, and demanding significant improvement to public transport and noise insulation schemes.
issues.socialWelfare: Wants to make Hounslow an early adopter of the Living Wage for employees and contractors.

leaflet.personalStatement: Lived in the area for nearly 30 years with family, knows the impact the issues have on residents. Worked to ensure a fairer Hounslow and safeguard the NHS.

politicalExperience.role: Planning professional, advocate for cycling infrastructure, trustee of a social justice charity, and a councillor
politicalExperience.achievements: Developed the Parliamentary strategy for Sustrans, the National cycling charity, and has a long history of environmental and social welfare work.

images.caption: Ruth Cadbury - Labour's candidate for Brentford & Isleworth

leaflet.additionalNotes: Urges constituents to vote for Labour to prevent the Conservative party from winning, stating that 'We all know that the Tories took Brentford & Isleworth with a majority of 1,958; from among an electorate of nearly 80,000 people.'
